title: James McClean posts emotional tribute from FAI Awards to former teammate and Derry City captain Ryan McBride

James McClean posted an emotional tribute from the FAI Awards on Sunday night to former teammate and Derry City captain Ryan McBride following the defender's shock death. 
The 27-year-old was found dead at home on Sunday, a day after he led his side to a 4-0 League of Ireland win over Drogheda United. 
Cause of death is unknown at this stage. 
McClean shared a live rendition of The Dubliners - 'The Town I Loved So Well' and captioned, "No fitting song". Ryan McBride playing for Derry City (Photo: Sportsfile) 
The winger was nominated for the International Goal of the Year award for his effort against Austria in a 2018 World Cup Qualifier. 
West Brom's McClean played alongside McBride at Northern Ireland sides Institute and Derry. McClean was excused from Republic of Ireland training on Monday due to the shock news. 
Upon hearing the news, the 27-year-old took to Instagram to express his sadness. He said: "Tonight we lost someone I had the privilege to play along aside but also got on well with off the field. McClean was nominated for the International Goal of the Year award (Photo: Sportsfile) 
"A warrior that literally would throw his body on the line when he pulled on that Derry City jersey, a club that meant so much to him. 
"But more importantly a big gentleman of the field... sleep tight big man may god bless you and your family." 
McBride was Derry born and bred, and news of his sudden death rocked not just the ceremony on Sunday but the global football community. Like us on Facebook
